intro: Acianthopsis, commonly known as the "buttercup grass," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its fine, grass-like leaves and small, often yellow or greenish flowers that are clustered in spikelets. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments, such as wet meadows and stream banks. Acianthopsis species are often found in regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for various microorganisms.
